sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
To the most high and mighty prince, Charles the II. By the grace of God, King of Great Britain, France and Ireland, defender of the faith, &c. An epistle written and humbly presented for His Majesties use, and enlightning of the nation. / By Arise Evans. Evans, Arise, b. 1607.
[2], 78 p.
Printed for R. Lowndes at the White Lion in S. Pauls Church-yard, and Simon Gape next door to the Hercules Pillars in Fleet-street, London : 1660.
Running title: For His Majesties use, and enlightning of the nation. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aug:". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
To the most high and mighty prince, Charles the II. By the grace of God, King of Great Britain, France and Ireland, defender of the faith, &c. An epistle written and humbly presented for His Majesties use, and enlightning of the nation. / By Arise Evans. Evans, Arise, b. 1607.
[2], 78 p.
Printed for R. Lowndes at the White Lion in S. Pauls Church-yard, and Simon Gape next door to the Hercules Pillars in Fleet-street, London : 1660.
Running title: For His Majesties use, and enlightning of the nation. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aug:". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
R. Lowndes
Simon Gape next door to the Hercules Pillars
Fleet-street
the White Lion in S. Pauls Church-yard
